plugins.name: Theme Buddy for Ant Design
plugins.description:
Theme Buddy for Ant Design

Theme Buddy for Ant Design is a Figma plugin that simplifies working with Ant Design themes. It has an export feature that lets you save Figma theme settings as JSON files, making it easy for developers to ensure their code matches Figma designs. It also has an import feature that allows you to apply theme settings from your code directly into Figma.


Learn more


Requirements

  1. Must have the Ant Design System for Figma version 5.11 or newer.
  2. Compatible only with Ant Design System for Figma and AntBlocks UI, not with other UI kits.
  3. JSON output is usable in the React version of Ant Design (5.0+).


How to use it?

Read the documentation here.

accepted.name: Matt Wierzbicki
accepted.description: Product designer and entrepreneur running multiple projects.

plugins.tagline: Transfer theme settings from Figma to React by converting Figma variables into a JSON format

103850.tagline: Transfer theme settings from Figma to React by converting Figma variables into a JSON format

plugins.name: Raster
plugins.description:
Raster is a photo manager and editor for modern teams. With this plugin, you can use photos from your Raster libraries directly in Figma.


A DAM from the future— Raster focuses on improving efficiency for teams that want to save time when shipping photography and digital assets. Raster organizes images with AI tags, allows real-time collaborative editing with unlimited versioning, and hosts each file and version on a world-class CDN, letting you ship your photography, faster.
plugins.tagline: Photo manager and editor for modern teams.

47194.description:

47194.tagline: Photo manager and editor for modern teams.

plugins.name: Klever - Instant Usability testing
plugins.description:
We value your feedback! Please take a moment to participate in our survey!


Get an instant usability testing report of your design with the AI AppAgent. Inspired by AppAgent: Multimodal Agents as Smartphone Users, Klever is a Figma plugin project designed to empower designers and developers by providing AI-driven insights into their UI designs.


Features

  1. GPT-4o Powered Multimodal Agents: Utilize advanced AI to understand both screenshots and text descriptions, simulating real-world user interactions with your UI.
  2. Instant Usability Reports: Receive comprehensive usability testing reports within seconds, highlighting potential usability issues and offering actionable recommendations.
  3. Persona Simulation: Experiment with different user personas to see how various users might experience your design.
  4. Seamless Figma Integration: Analyze your designs directly within Figma, streamlining your workflow.


How to Use Klever

  1. Open the design file you want to analyze in Figma.
  2. Navigate to Plugins > Klever and open the plugin.
  3. Enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one, get it from here. Make sure you have access to GPT-4o.
  4. Select the frame or component you want to analyze.
  5. (Optional) Create a Task for the AI to perform and set up different personas.
  6. Click "Submit" or press "Cmd/Ctrl + Enter" to receive your AI-powered usability testing report.


Contributing

We aim to improve Klever by enhancing the AppAgent Figma prototype. If you're interested in contributing, please visit our repository or the original Python project, AppAgent:


  1. Contribute to Klever
  2. Contribute to AppAgent


Your contributions can significantly impact designers and developers worldwide.


Acknowledgments

This project was inspired by Tencent's research on AppAgent: Multimodal Agents as Smartphone Users. We are grateful for their groundbreaking work in AI and usability testing.
plugins.tagline: A clever analyzing tool for UI powered by AI

plugins.name: Bounding Box
plugins.description:
Bounding Box allows designers to easily create and customize bounding boxes around their design elements. With a variety of options, such as color, stroke weight, dash patterns, and box styles, users can effortlessly define and style bounding boxes to fit their design aesthetics.


How to Use


Select the objects that you want to put within the bounding box. Run the plugin and you can customize the following properties :

  • Color
  • Stroke Weight
  • Dashes


Three different types of bounding boxes can be created

  • A box with corner rectangles that have a stroke and fill
  • A box with corner rectangles that have only a fill color
  • A box with no corner rectangles
plugins.tagline: A handy plugin to create bounding boxes with different styles from your selections

plugins.name: Full
plugins.description:
Fit layer to container width / height / both, margin supported.


Usage:

1. If selection's width > height, then full width

2. If selection's height > width, then full height

3. if width = height, then full both (and it will have a new name, to keep it as background)

29649.name: Full
29649.description:
Fit layer to container width / height / both, margin supported.


Usage:

1. If selection's width > height, then full width

2. If selection's height > width, then full height

3. if width = height, then full both (and it will have a new name, to keep it as background)

plugins.name: Color Combinator
plugins.description:
Color Combinator (CC) is a Figma plugin for exploring different combinations of colors among elements.

Select elements that you want to see different combinations of and then hit the “Combinate Colors” button in the CC plugin window. Copies of your frame will appear to the right of the original and each will contain a different assignment of colors to elements.

I strongly encourage you to check out the demo video to see it in action: https://vimeo.com/361205568

  CC is a brand new plugin and has a few limitations:
- Supports only Text Nodes 
- Nodes must have only one fill that is a solid paint
- Nodes must be contained in a Frame

plugins.name: Pagination
plugins.description:
Pagination is the most efficient way to paginate your slides.


Are you using Figma prototype to create presentations? If so, you've likely faced the challenge of adding pagination, just like we did, whether manually or with unreliable plugins.


That's why we developed Pagination: our own simple solution to make pagination less frustrating.


How it works?

  1. Add a {current} text layer for each page number.
  2. Include a {total} text layer for the total page count.
  3. Select frames, if you don’t paginate everything.
  4. Let the plugin automatically rename and reorder frames, and paginate!


Tips & tricks

  1. Place {current} and {total} occurrences in separate text layers.
  2. Pagination handles hidden {current} occurrences.
  3. Insert a separator text layer of your choice between {current} and {total}.
  4. Pagination follows the natural reading order in Figma, from top-left to bottom-right.
  5. No need to update numbering if the slide order changes or duplicates occur. Simply run the plugin again, and Pagination will take care of it!


About

Pagination is built by Source.paris and inspired by Numerator.

We specialize in helping companies solve complex problems, drive business growth, and delight their customers through Design & Engineering.


If you have questions, suggestions or feedback, just leave a comment below and we’ll try to answer ASAP.


Happy paginating!

accepted.name: Olivier Chatel
accepted.description:
UX Designer | Managing director source.paris
Bureau of Design & Technology

plugins.tagline: The most efficient way to number your slides

plugins.name: DesignFast: Landing Page Generator (AI, Ecommerce, Finance, Education, Shopping, CRM...)
plugins.description:
🚀 A Figma plugin that transforms anyone into a landing page designer! 🚀


1. Landing Page Generator

Transform your ideas into stunning landing pages in seconds with just one prompt and a single click.


Prompt to Design

  1. Instantly convert your text descriptions into professional landing page designs
  2. No design experience needed - simply describe what you want


Responsive Support

  1. Import designs with custom resolutions across multiple platforms simultaneously
  2. Generate desktop, tablet, and mobile designs with one click
  3. Effortlessly maintain design consistency across all platforms


Fully Editable Designs

  1. All generated landing pages are completely editable when imported to Figma
  2. Every element can be customized to match your brand style


Real-time Preview

  1. See your landing page generation results in real time
  2. Refine your design through iterative conversations


2. Landing Page Kit: Find Design Inspiration

  1. Access over 1,000+ pages for inspiration
  2. Regular updates featuring the latest design trends
  3. Wide range of categories available for filtering
  4. Quick and accurate search for your desired content


We believe everyone can create amazing landing pages with the right tools. Let DesignFast inspire and empower your creativity!


For more information, visit our official website: https://designfast.io
plugins.tagline: Generate landing pages with AI prompts or explore 1000+ templates for instant design inspiration

plugins.name: Dash
plugins.description:
Figma faster with Dash

Quickly find, select and edit layers without taking your hands off your keyboard. Dash consists of 2 parts:


1. Layer search

Find and select layers quickly by keyword and filter just the relevant ones, like only text layers, frames or rectangles. Supports modifiers for expanding the current selection, selecting a parent up the layer tree and even globbing patterns for advanced use cases.


2. Actions

With Actions, you easily change multiple layer properties at once. From changing font sizes, #color, renaming layers and adding component instances, Dash is the fastest way to do so.


Free while in beta

Dash is free to use but for now requires a license still. Get a free license here!


Get started quickly

Want to quickly get comfy with all of Dash's features? Check out the official playground template!


Visit the Dash website for more info.

accepted.name: Andre Jilderda
accepted.description: Freelance front-end developer with a background in design, maker of Figma plugin Dash: http://getdash.app/

plugins.tagline: Quickly find, select and edit layers without taking your hands off your keyboard.

plugins.name: Image to 1px rectangles
plugins.description:
Select an image then Run Plugin to generate a grid of 1px rectangles from the selection

After running the plugin, try:
- Use Figma's red lines to measure distances between pixels
- Use Figma's "Select All with Same Fill" to edit pixels in groups
- Select pixels and Flatten ⌘E

Careful: this Plugin becomes slow for large images (larger than 200x200)

plugins.name: Name Lint
plugins.description:
Name Lint

An easy way to find and rename all default-named elements in the current page.

Default-named elements include (where N is a number):

  • Frame N
  • Group N
  • Rectangle N
  • Ellipse N
  • ...

Why?

This plugin is particularly useful to prepare designs for developer-handoff, where developers usually name their variables and classes using the designers names.

Having the same element names in both Figma and your codebase makes the communication between designers and developer easier, but also makes it easier to backtrace elements from code to design and iterate faster.

More info

Open source: https://github.com/richardguerre/figma-name-lint

Inspired by the Design Lint Figma Plugin by destefanis.

accepted.name: Richard Guerre
accepted.description: Currently in stealth mode | Check out my "One Figma Shortcut a Day" browser extension and "Name Lint" Figma plugin

plugins.name: DesignSystemColours
plugins.description:
A tool to speed up the process of creating the colour palette of a design system.


With this tool, colour styles will automatically be added, using the standard BEM naming convention, making access and usage during design as easy as possible.


How to use:


  1. Find a colour you want to use in your design.
  2. Convert the colour to HEX (or RGB) format and make a note of the value(s).
  3. Input these values to the plugin, and the rest will be done for you!


If you have any suggestions for how this plugin could be improved, please let me know :)


Comment how you find the plugin, and how much it improves your design system process - I would be really interested to know if you find it useful.

38180.name: DesignSystemColours
38180.description:
A tool to speed up the process of creating the colour palette of a design system.


With this tool, colour styles will automatically be added, using the standard BEM naming convention, making access and usage during design as easy as possible.


How to use:


  1. Find a colour you want to use in your design.
  2. Convert the colour to HEX (or RGB) format and make a note of the value(s).
  3. Input these values to the plugin, and the rest will be done for you!


If you have any suggestions for how this plugin could be improved, please let me know :)


Comment how you find the plugin, and how much it improves your design system process - I would be really interested to know if you find it useful.

plugins.name: Butler
plugins.description:
Butler helps you with three things:


- It let’s you search for local components to insert your current

position


- You can apply any local style to your current selection


- Go to any node in your document


Open the plugin, press TAB to switch commands or search for your desired component or style.


Caveats:


Users working with large documents may experience long loading times, this is due to how you’re allowed to fetch assets from the API.


Local assets only, meaning that unfortunately styles and components from your libraries won’t be collected. Also due to what is allowed to collect or not from the API, (and probably righteously so concerning security risks).


I’ve found a kind of similair plugin called Figma Walker made by Kazushi Kawamura,

you can find his plugins here: https://www.figma.com/@kawamurakazushi


Repository:

https://github.com/MikaelWeidenhielm/butler-figma-plugin

2706.description:

Open the plugin, press TAB to switch commands or search for your desired component or style.


Caveats:


Users working with large documents may experience long loading times, this is due to how you’re allowed to fetch assets from the API.


Local assets only, meaning that unfortunately styles and components from your libraries won’t be collected. Also due to what is allowed to collect or not from the API, (and probably righteously so concerning security risks).


I’ve found a kind of similair plugin called Figma Walker made by Kazushi Kawamura,

you can find his plugins here: https://www.figma.com/@kawamurakazushi

plugins.name: Detach Master
plugins.description:
Detach Master is a Figma plugin that allows you to quickly detach various properties within a selected frame. It simplifies the editing process by providing selective detachment options, making design modifications more efficient.


Usage

1. Select a frame or area where you want to detach elements

2. Choose the specific detach options:

  1. Detach Instances
  2. Detach Text Styles
  3. Detach Color Styles
  4. Detach Effect Styles
  5. Detach Grid Styles
  6. Detach Variables
  7. Remove Auto-layout
  8. Remove Hidden Layers

3. Press the Detach button to apply the selected actions.



Do you have any feedback?


If you have any inquiries, feel free to contact us anytime at designbasekorea@gmail.com.


Website: https://designbase.co.kr/

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/designbase

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/designbasekorea/


© 2024 DesignBase. All rights reserved
plugins.tagline: Detach instances, styles, variables, and more within the selected frame

121979.name: Detach Master
121979.description:
Detach Master is a Figma plugin that allows you to quickly detach various properties within a selected frame. It simplifies the editing process by providing selective detachment options, making design modifications more efficient.


Usage

1. Select a frame or area where you want to detach elements

2. Choose the specific detach options:

  1. Detach Instances
  2. Detach Text Styles
  3. Detach Color Styles
  4. Detach Effect Styles
  5. Detach Grid Styles
  6. Detach Variables
  7. Remove Auto-layout
  8. Remove Hidden Layers

3. Press the Detach button to apply the selected actions.



Do you have any feedback?


If you have any inquiries, feel free to contact us anytime at designbasekorea@gmail.com.


Website: https://designbase.co.kr/

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/designbase

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/designbasekorea/


© 2024 DesignBase. All rights reserved
121979.release_notes:
We’re excited to introduce Detach Master, a powerful update that enhances your Figma workflow by providing granular control over component detachment.

✨ New Features
Now, you can selectively detach various elements within a selected frame, making it easier than ever to modify and refine your designs.

Detach Instances → Convert instance components into regular layers.
Detach Text Styles → Remove linked text styles while preserving content.
Detach Color Styles → Unlink applied color styles for custom adjustments.
Detach Effect Styles → Convert effect styles into editable properties.
Detach Grid Styles → Break away from predefined grid structures.
Detach Variables → Unlink all variable-based properties.
Remove Auto-layout → Convert auto-layout frames into free-positioned layers.
Remove Hidden Layers → Clean up your design by automatically removing hidden elements.
🛠️ Improvements
Enhanced performance for handling large-scale files.
More intuitive UI/UX for selecting detachment options.
Faster detachment process for smoother workflow.
121979.tagline: Detach instances, styles, variables, and more within the selected frame

plugins.name: Glyphero
plugins.description:
Import icons collection into Figma as organized component.

Support file download from iconfont.cn, icomoon.io, fontello.com, iconly.io, etc..


How to use

  1. Open plugin
  2. Select one supported file
  3. Click ‘Import’, done!


Support File

Usually, all-in-one .svg file made up by <glyph> or <symbol> tags could be supported.

Files download from sites below is tested:

  • https://iconfont.cn
  • https://icomoon.io
  • https://fontello.com
  • https://iconly.io
  • https://fontawesome.com

This plugin is based on saxi by Jeremy Rose @nornagon.


Thanks to Evil Mad Scientist Laboratories (creators of the AxiDraw) for making pen plotting accessible to almost everyone!


Find out more about AxiDraw: https://axidraw.com/

plugins.name: Apply Local Styles
plugins.description:
Reassign an external style to a local style of the same name in a matter of seconds.


The plugin doesn't have an interface.


How does it work:

  1. Select some layers you want to update. When nothing is selected, all layers on the page are updated.
  2. Launch the plugin. The plugin will identify styles with matching names associated with local styles, and apply them all at once based on your selection.
  3. A layer whose style has not been updated will be highlighted.


--

The plugin may slow down if there are too many layers on the page. If this is the case, try selecting layers instead.
plugins.tagline: reassign styles, external → local

47825.name: Apply Local Styles
47825.description:
Reassign an external style to a local style of the same name in a matter of seconds.


The plugin doesn't have an interface.


How does it work:

  1. Select some layers you want to update. When nothing is selected, all layers on the page are updated.
  2. Launch the plugin. The plugin will identify styles with matching names associated with local styles, and apply them all at once based on your selection.
  3. A layer whose style has not been updated will be highlighted.


--

The plugin may slow down if there are too many layers on the page. If this is the case, try selecting layers instead.

plugins.name: Word Spacing
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to adjust word spacing for text elements.


Basic usage:

  1. Select one or more text elements.
  2. Open the plugin and use the input to modify the word spacing of the selected elements.


You can also set word spacing for specific sections within the same text object.


Important Note:

When using this plugin, be mindful that altering the word spacing directly modifies the text inside the text element(s).

For questions or requests you can send me an email at basvanderlinden53@outlook.com

plugins.name: Lasca - No more frontend-coding
plugins.description:
No more front-end coding by integrating Figma with React/vue.js/webpack


Lasca is a new type of no-code platform designed for developers to automate front-end coding for not only static websites but also production applications, and build them dramatically faster.


No-code is generally considered to be skeptical and not developer-friendly because of its technical debt and high learning and switching cost. However, Lasca enables front-end automation in a completely developer-friendly way through the following approaches.



How it works


1. Convert Figma designs including responsiveness to HTML & CSS perfectly


Lasca converts not only visual elements but also responsive web design using Figma’s constraints and auto layout precisely.


2. Configure UI logics & interaction with APIs


Lasca allows you to configure UI logics (condition, loop, variable, event) and interaction with API. They are essential to web applications.


3. With combination with your own coding, there is nothing you can’t build


Converted code will be automatically inserted into your frontend code in the place of lasca tag ( <lasca></lasca> ) through your build process with webpack.


Lasca does not control entire our vue.js project. It is incrementally adoptable. You can choose to automate the front-end using the lasca tag or code it yourself in various ways.



Get started


You can test Lasca quickly using Get started guide here.



Resources


You may find certain features do not export correctly. Please reach out to a list of limitations of Figma export here. Also, if you encounter any bugs, please let us know and we'll be able to fix it rapidly :) You can contact us from here.

accepted.name: Lasca
accepted.description: Just import Figma. No more frontend-coding - HTML & CSS

plugins.name: GlobalLink Strings Localization Plugin
plugins.description:
GlobalLink Strings is a localization management platform for continuous software localization projects. It is designed to automate localization tasks for developers and offers business users a single place to manage all parts of the localization and translation workflow in as much detail as desired.


Learn more on the GlobalLink Strings website: globallinkstrings.com


GL Strings and Figma

The GL Strings Figma plugin makes it easy to start your translation process already in the design stage and uses the text elements and layouts in your Figma file as the starting point.


As a designer, you can easily collaborate with your product and developer teams on GL Strings without any back and forth or the need to convert your designs into any other format.


You can simply upload everything, all texts as well as screenshots via the plugin. On GL Strings the screenshots serve as valuable context for your translators.


In Short

1) Upload all your text from Figma to GL Strings

2) Generate screenshots of your designs and upload them too.

3) Download translations from GL Strings to preview them in your designs

4) Move your text and translations over to the app after the design phase is done via GL Strings


You can find the full Figma plugin documentation here https://www.globallinkstrings.com/docs/integration-documentation/figma


This plugin requires a GL Strings account. Sign-up for free here

https://dashboard.globallinkstrings.com/!/#/signup
plugins.tagline: Automate the translation process of your Figma projects

plugins.name: Copy Text/Html
plugins.description:
About

This plugin will extract the text/html data from the Figma clipboard and copy it again to your clipboard, so you can store it or reconstruct the clipboard later.


How to use

  1. Copy any element inside any project (CMD/CTRL + C)
  2. Select the plugin window and press (CMD/CTRL + V)
  3. Data is now copied to your clipboard!
  4. Paste the data anywhere you want.


Codepen example

How to reconstruct clipboard and paste back to Figma

https://codepen.io/cerpow/pen/mdGYxYp


For support, contact me at cerpow@gmail.com

www.cerpow.com
plugins.tagline: Copy text/html data from Figma's clipboard.

plugins.name: Blueprint Icon Library by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the Blueprint Icon Library open source library. It’s an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 563 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Blueprint Icon Library icons:

  • Checkmark & success icons
  • Interface and app icons
  • Alert and messaging icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Blueprint Icon Library icons

accepted.description: 275,000+ open source icons, illustrations, emojis, logos, flags, clipart and graphics. Free to use on personal and commercial projects.

plugins.tagline: Blueprint Icon Library is an open source library of 563 icons. Free to use in all your designs!

90520.name: Blueprint Icon Library by Iconduck
90520.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the Blueprint Icon Library open source library. It’s an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 563 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Blueprint Icon Library icons:

  • Checkmark & success icons
  • Interface and app icons
  • Alert and messaging icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Blueprint Icon Library icons
90520.tagline: Blueprint Icon Library is an open source library of 563 icons. Free to use in all your designs!

plugins.name: Lazy Loading
plugins.description: Elevate your design workflow with our Skeleton Loader plugin! Easily create sleek, customizable loading states with options for solid colors, gradient effects, and precise hex code selections. Perfect for crafting placeholders that match your brand and enhance user experience seamlessly.
plugins.tagline: Loading states, redefined with style.
